results.title: An Open-Label Phase I Study of Metformin and Nelfinavir in Combination With Bortezomib in Patients With Relapsed and Refractory Multiple Myeloma.
results.text_hl: Fortunately, 1 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ experienced an @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Stable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@SD@@@ response, allowing this combination to stabilize their disease until another novel therapy on a clinical trial was available.

citations.NLM: Alodhaibi I, Ailawadhi S, Burbano GP, O'Brien PJ, Buadi FK, Hayman S, Kumar SK, Gonsalves WI. An Open-Label Phase I Study of Metformin and Nelfinavir in Combination With Bortezomib in Patients With Relapsed and Refractory Multiple Myeloma. Clin Lymphoma Myeloma Leuk. 2024 Jan 6;():. PMID: 38220589

results.title: [Optimization of stable angina standard therapy in patients with concomitant osteoarthritis and obesity].
results.text_hl: Correction of @CHEMICAL_Carbohydrates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002241 @@@carbohydrate@@@ metabolism on the background of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment, helped to improve @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ metabolism, suggesting greater efficiency of HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors (statins) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Stable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@SAP@@@ on a background of the proposed method.

citations.NLM: Teslenko IuV. [Optimization of stable angina standard therapy in patients with concomitant osteoarthritis and obesity]. Georgian Med News. 2013 Nov;(224):38-45. PMID: 24323963

results.title: Effects of Metformin Therapy on Coronary Endothelial Dysfunction in Patients With Prediabetes With Stable Angina and Nonobstructive Coronary Artery Stenosis: The CODYCE Multicenter Prospective Study.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Therapy on @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@Coronary Endothelial Dysfunction@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ With @DISEASE_Prediabetic_State @DISEASE_MESH:D011236 @@@Prediabetes@@@ With @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Stable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@Stable Angina@@@ and Nonobstructive @DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@Coronary Artery Stenosis@@@: The CODYCE Multicenter Prospective Study.

results.title: Differential associations of circulating asymmetric dimethylarginine and cell adhesion molecules with metformin use in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus and stable coronary artery disease.
results.text_hl: Our aim was to compare biochemical endothelial markers in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with stable @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ (@DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@CAD@@@) and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ stratified by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use. We studied 70 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (29 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, age 68 +- 9 years) with established @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ referred for elective coronary angiography owing to @<m>DISEASE_Angina_Stable</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@stable angina@@@ who were receiving a standard CV medication and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or other oral antidiabetic drugs.

citations.NLM: Kruszelnicka O, Chyrchel B, Golay A, Surdacki A. Differential associations of circulating asymmetric dimethylarginine and cell adhesion molecules with metformin use in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus and stable coronary artery disease. Amino Acids. 2015 Sep;47(9):1951-9. PMID: 25859650
